image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Indiana; born in Valparaiso, Porter County, Ind., January 21, 1916; attended Union Township Elementary and Wheeler High School; elected to the Indiana State senate, 1959-1968; owner and operator, Landgrebe Motor Transport, Inc.; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-first and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1969-January 3, 1975); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1974 to the Ninety-fourth Congress; was a resident of Valparaiso, Ind., until his death there June 29, 1986; interment in Blachly Cemetery, Crown Point, Ind.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Ralph Nader Congress Project. Citizens Look at Congress: Earl F. Landgrebe, Republican Representative from Indiana. Washington, D. C.: Grossman Publishers, 1972.

researchRecord.name: 1969-1974, 71 boxes.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Earl Landgrebe contain correspondence, reports, and legislation, relating to various issues before Congress, including consumer protection, elementary and secondary education, tax reform, pollution control, farm bills, Watergate, war in Vietnam, defense spending, abortion, draft, foreign aid, railroads, public land use, poverty programs, Pueblo incident, and the U.S. Food and Drug Administration. Also included are papers relating to Earl Landgrebe's district, such as nuclear power plant construction, pollution of Lake Michigan and development of the lakeshore, Indiana Dunes State Park, and grants for local programs and studies. Earl Landgrebe's attempts to distribute Bibles in the Soviet Union (1972) are also document, as well as correspondence regarding constituent problems, newsletters, press releases, and information released by his office, and papers relating to his election campaigns, voting records, and the Republican Party.

researchRecord.name: 1959-1974, 12 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Earl Landgrebe chiefly relate to his activities in Congress and his service in the Indiana State Senate. Topics include Earl Landgrebe's support of Richard M. Nixon during the Watergate affair, the energy crisis of the early 1970s, railroad reorganization, Indiana Dunes National Lakeshore, a proposed sewage disposal and waste treatment plan for Chicago and the south end of Lake Michigan, and political campaigns. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.
